review: Friendly service at this location , was able to be sat right away and it being a cooler evening we opted to seat outside . Does need some more umbrellas to help w the sun setting. Pep Mushroom and Sausage Pizza is good for sharing but also need an appetizer prior. Complimentary bread with Olive oil . Often times I have to ask for sugar for my Arnold Palmer , but not this time as they made it just right .

I mean, it's a CPK. You know what you're in for when you step in. You should, at least. My friend and I were in Anaheim for the weekend, up to celebrate our birthdays the only way we know how: a weekend full of Disney geekiness. We drove up midday on Friday, checked in to our hotel, hopped over to a spa for a facial and massage, and as we were driving back to our hotel, we both realized that we hadn't eaten anything all day. It was almost 7 pm by then. We were starving, and CPK was the only restaurant that had no wait at that time. We got a table on the patio because though it was 7 pm in October, it was still hot as balls. Our waitress was sweet, but golly, she took her time getting to us. Never a good thing when you're famished, you know? Once we were able to place our orders, we got the Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower to share. I went with the Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti and my friend got the Banh Mi Bowl. We of course also ordered cocktails, because vacation. The food took forever to get to us, but at least we had bread to gnaw on. When we did get fed (and had our second round of cocktails - we each got the sangria flight), the food was okay. I think I liked mine a lot more than my friend liked hers, which is unfortunate because she was the one most feeling the need for food. She had to ask for extra dressing for her bowl because she said everything was so dry. She didn't seem to like the flavors of the meal, either. My pasta dish was okay. It was saucy but not very flavorful. I powered through the dish in record time, then sat there feeling like a pig and wondering if I was satiated. Side note - there was an altercation on the street outside of CPK while we were sitting there. The police were called, and at one point, the CPK manager came out to check on us. It was nice of them to be concerned, at least.
There kungpao spaghetti is so good. Sometimes servers are good. Sometimes too busy. However, only 1 cpk mdr near my home- playa vista.

Tasty.  I was staying in the Anaheim area and this was located in the Anaheim Gardenwalk, so we decided to give this place a try. Was so dependable, that we came here at least 4 times during our visit.  The pizza is good and light. While the pizza is good, it's of course going to have a different taste than most pizzeria slices. A personal pie is probably the equivalent of 2 regular pizzeria slices for a size comparison. The one thing I wasn't exactly a fan of was the prices, which were high with what you were getting. A kid's pie and 1 personal pie was over $20 - but I had no real complaints, since it was a filling option with minimal wait. The pizza always tasted great. I only ordered takeout, so no comments on the dining in experience. The staff in which I encountered were always friendly and courteous.  Located on the Katella side of the Gardenwalk next to PF Chang.  A good option if you're in the area, whether you live or are staying in the vicinity.

Came here last Sunday night (7/23/17) prior to the concert at HOB Anaheim and there were just so many problems during our meal... 1. Dirty Plates and etc. No silverware and napkins. 2. Chicken Tequila Fettuccine Undercooked pasta and burnt. 3. Pizza Dough Rewards Processing the rewards is as slow as molasses. Ordered: 1/2 Waldorf Chicken Salad Chicken Tequila Fettuccine 1/2 Thai Crunch Salad Gluten-Free Crust Roasted Garlic Chicken Having been to the GardenWalk multiple times over the years, I've been to Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gump, and now CPK. The GardenWalk is conveniently located nearby to the Convention Center and the nearby hotels so there are often lots of tourists around so some restaurants can get pretty packed. Having known that, we decided to try the "Call Ahead" feature where one can call up to 1-hr ahead prior to arriving at the restaurant and get priority seating.  We called ahead and arrived within 30 minutes of the time we stated and did have priority seating. There were a few groups waiting here and there but also lots of empty tables. It seems that they were short servers, thus half the restaurant was empty.  The plates initial plates on the tables still had food encrusted on them and I had to ask Franky, our server, to switch one of the plates out. We were sat at a table of 4 for the 2 of us but it worked out because our 2 other friends were able to join us for dinner prior to the concert at HOB.  Granted, I haven't had the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine in years but I do not remember it being this poorly cooked. I had the hardest time trying to figure out why my pasta wasn't al dente but there were burnt marks also. So they undercooked the pasta and then tossed it with the sauce but let it sit on the burner too long and burned the bottom. There were lots of ingredients but the noodles themselves were quite disappointing and that is what makes the dish a pasta.  We didn't have enough time to head to a coffee shop nearby and decided to order coffee here, there was something black inside of my creamer container. I am guessing it is a pepper or something but what is it doing in the container?  When our other 2 friends joined us for dinner, no utensils/napkins or even bread were brought over for them. The two of us had already finished our bread and was starting our main dishes so there obviously was not bread for them. I had to go ask for menus from the hostesses and also grab utensils for them when their food was brought after they ordered.  When we were paying for our bill, it took a very long time. I had mentioned at the beginning of the meal that I had a dough reward and Franky mentioned I could provide my phone number or email address at the end of the meal. A bit of a tedious process as I had to write it on the check and then have him re-run and then have the manager apply the dough rewards. It took over 10 minutes having the manager apply the rewards. We were running a bit later than we had expected and hoped to pay and head over to HOB but this was the part that took the longest. Even my friends who had only 1 card for one check, took them the same amount of time. It seems that the servers do not clear the check and that the manger does it. I am also guessing only 1 credit card machine. For a restaurant located on the GardenWalk, I expected more efficiency as they must have high volume of customers during busy times. Â  They do validate for 1 hour and can be validated by the server when paying for your meal.

This place and location are great since theres hardly a wait unless you come with a group of 10. My favorite dishes here are the Bbq chicken chopped salad, Santa Fe Pizza, Garlic Fettuccine Alfredo. We came here the other day for a special event "Chef Challenge" and we got to sample a mushroom noodle dish and it was so good!! I was surprised since i don't really mix it up that much once i find my favorite dishes. After being seated a waiter will shortly be with you to offer complimentary house bread with a oil infused herb dipping sauce. They have Pepsi products here so sorry guys No Coke!! They also offer Alcoholic drinks as well, i feel every time i come back they have a new season beverage. My favorite dessert is the Dark Chocolate Molten Lava cake!! guys its seriously the perfect combination of sweet but not too sweet and decadent!!

Emily was our server. We're regulars and come here often me and my wife always get the BBQ pizza and Thai crunch salad.  Her service was excellent always have smile on her face most importantly brining our food to us asap! Again I commend her for her excellent customer service. Manager of CPK please give her a recognition! -Andrew Alice

Lunch on Saturday, 3/25/17 Our large party of 10 came by after a matinee showing at Downtown Disney. The parking structure had plenty of parking spots around 1pm. With our restaurant validation, parking was free. The wait was about 15 minutes for the server to set up our table. Even though our party was quite large, the server was great in following up on our orders. He came to assist us with refills and additional condiments when he was available since the restaurant was full. The complimentary bread comes with olive oil instead of butter. It's been a while since I've visited a CPK. I ordered the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza to get a refresher of how great it tasted. It's not loaded with too many toppings and it still has quite a thin hand-tossed crust so I was able to finish it. The crust was crispy and soft enough to bite through. I didn't have room to order anything else with my meal after the nachos and soda from the movie theater. It's definitely a recommended place whenever there's a pizza craving. I remember liking the Kung Pao spaghetti and the Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad. I haven't had anything I didn't like so far and their service has been attentive.

Hands down THE BEST CPK I have ever been to. I wish they were closer to my house! After a long day at Disneyland we wanted to get out of the park and eat close by. We saw CPK was close and hopped in the car. (About 7 mins from Disneyland). I have to make a notable mention to Tommy the manager here who saw we were with hungry kids and made sure we got our food very quickly. He went ABOvE and BeyOND to take care of us. CPK is mt favorite chain restaurant and the food is always good. But it was Tommy who took the experience to another level by the exceptional customer service he provided us. It was unforgettable. I hope this location's area management recognizes his value to the team.

California Pizza Kitchen is my favorite pizza place.  This particular location is very nice  The food I had was as perfect as ever and the service was great.  I definitely recommend it, there's plenty of parking and other little shops around it In case you need to go on a walk after accidentally eating too much pizza (happens to me all the time!)
We came to this CPK a few weeks ago and the Food was great . The server was really nice and friendly too , we would definitely Come back

I like the Brea and Anaheim (Disney Resort Area) locations the best, although any location serves excellent food. Greeters welcome you, servers are accommodating and knowledgeable about their offerings. I never had a bad experience at any of their locations. In fact, CPK is one of my top 10 favorite restaurant chains. Try the Kung Pao Spaghetti. It's a signature dish that can only be found here. I know, the name sounds a tad bit strange but it is absolutely 'Da Bomb" for the lack of a better description. Add chicken and shrimp. You'll need to wash your meal down with a fresh strawberry mango cooler. I mean, I could probably drink those all day and night but then again I wouldn't get any sleep. They are non-alcoholic. Try it and tell me what you think! Two thumbs up for this meal! Oh!, and don't miss out on the complimentary fresh bread and olive oil dip.

Every restaurant at Anaheim Garden Walk was packed and the average wait for a party of 5 was about 1.5 hours. The wait at CPK was only 50 mins so we decided to stay because we were starving.  The wait wasn't too bad and the greeter was really nice.  After we were seated the first thing I noticed is that CPK has really moved away from highlighting their pizzas on the menu. I was a little disappointed as I've been a fan of their pizzas since 1990. There was a ton of other stuff on the menu that I didn't even know they served like steak, fish, and pasta.  The food took a while to get to the table and the waiter didn't really check in with us but hey, I get it, it was packed and it was really busy.  We ordered the plank Salmon, a pasta dish, arugula salad and a kids pizza. The sizes were a little small and the taste was kinda average. Not bad, but just average. Now the key is that if you are going to serve smaller dishes then the taste needs to be BIG. and they just didn't accomplish that.  Pricing was a little high in general but it's a Disneyland area restaurant and everybody charges a little more.

CPK is the restaurant you go to when you're not really feelin' anything else. Lol! Its really a place of comfort and chewy pizzas. I think they actually do better at non pizza dishes! The Salmon is great. Today I had the Mushroom, Sausage, & Pepperoni. Nothing to write home about. I would go with the salmon!

Came here with an out-of-town friend. I was shocked it wasn't crowded on a Friday night given its close to Disneyland and located on a main street at a mall. Walked in, was greeted, and seated right away.  Service = swift Food = good Sangrias = refreshing Vibe = mellow Parking structure = plentiful and the restaurant validates

It's been a very long time since I've been to a CPK. I'm glad that I came tonight and had the pleasure of Melissa to serve us. Â She is very engaging with her customers and is just an awesome CPK staff member. If you come to this CPK ask for Melissa.
Ate here 11/2/17 food was pretty good, it's your classic CPK and the service was fantastic! Our server was very happy and full of energy, kept checking in on us making sure everything was perfect.

Prices are very expensive . I got the power bowl and it had no flavor. I understand it's supposed to be healthy but man.... it was overpriced for plain. I could buy that in a store and make it myself for half price. Nonetheless, big portions and complementary bread . LOL.

Food was great and our waiter did a nice job handling a large group. Our biggest challenge was being seated. Â We entered for an early dinner...just a few occupied tables and the hostess said it would take 20 minutes to seat us?!? Â We sat and watched multiple parties being seated ahead of us. Â We ended up having a great outdoor spot for everyone but I'm still not sure why it took so long to seat our group when there were plenty of table options to place together.

The food was fine although The problem was waiting. Â We were sat quickly. Â Then we waited for the server to take drink orders, waited again for bread and again for food. Â The worst was the wait for the check. Â We were done for about 10 min and had a hard time flagging down server. Â He was nice enough and kept apologizing so I don't know if the problem was him or not enough staffing. Â There were two employees sitting at a booth maybe having a meeting but they never moved.

I usually always go to the CPK at the Los Cerritos Mall, but decided to give this place a try. First of all, Garden Walk is absolutely dead!! Although it's so close to Disneyland, there are barely any people here!  This CPK location is pretty spacious, and I liked the layout of it better than Cerritos. My sister, mom, and I visited this location for dinner on a Monday night. We ended up ordering: -2 soup bowl with baked potato soup and the chicken tortilla. They were both ok. I thought the soup would be in one bowl that was split into two. However, it's served in the same bowl.  -BBQ chicken salad: Can never go wrong with this salad. Always delicious  -Chipotle chicken pizza: My favorite pizza!! Love all the toppings on this pizza.  I was a bit disappointed with the service though. Our server was pretty slow and did not have a lot of common sense. We would have to ask her several times for items that we would obviously need. I know this isn't her fault, but this location ran out of Sprite! How are their sodas not always stocked?! We were first served soda that was not sweet, and then she comes back more than 5 minutes later telling us they ran out of syrup, so we had to order another soft drink. Pretty disappointing.

My son who's loving this place a lot . Now his birthday that he love to celebrate at here . We very happy with service Man (his name is Riley). We love the way that he take care of us . He's very patient to waiting everyone order. He's checking to make sure that we happy with everything. This place is the best place we love to come for eating. Thanks Riley .... we have great birthday dinner:-)

We love CPK anyways but we wanted to try something new so we tried to got to the Cheesecake Factory next door. After waiting for 20 minutes and watching tables that were seated behind us get their orders in, we left and decided to go our favorite restaurant CPK. We even told our server of the service we received next door and they gave us a complimentary appetizer! Their service and staff are top notch (also better prices than Cheesecake Factory ;)) thank you CPK for turning our dining experience around!  My favorite is the chicken tequila fettuccine!

My favorite place for pizza! I always get the BBQ pizza with extra mushroom. This place is nice since it is near Disney. And it is weird that everytime I come here I thought I was a tourist becuz of the environment out there. Great place for group and family.

I came to this CPK with few friends and we had a terrible experience. I'm not sure if it was the time we came around (10pm), but the service we received was not professional or close to even decent.  The food was okay just like any CPK. The waiter we had barely refilled our waters, didn't listen to our order requests, and it took a long time to get our food. Even after seeing our empty drinking cups, as he passed back and forth, there was never once he asked if we wanted a refill. We had to flag him down and I mean I can't totally blame him, but I feel it was really understaff on a Friday night.  Either everyone was at Escape Psycho Circus Rave and called out sick, or this CPK needs to pick it up and hire more staffs.

We came for a family dinner on a Friday night. We expected it to be a busy night. Was very disappointed in the service and how the place was understaffed. Recommend to the manager to bring more servers and have the busboys help with drinks. We had to ask multiple times for water and refills. Definitly not coming to this location.

Located in Anaheim's GardenWalk, California Pizza Kitchen (hereafter referred to CPK) is a beautiful interior in a fine location, heck, it's located next to the happiest place on earth, how could it not be a sweet spot?  Although they make their pizzas by hand (and you can see chef's tossing pizza dough behind the counter), there are very few modifications that can be made to any of the items on the menu because most of the food is pre-made. So right away, if you're particular about your food or want to pay for freshly created food, this is not the spot for you.  The food itself was okay just like any CPK. For the money you're paying, though, I'd expect the quality to be better. It's like Applebee quality food with Outback Steakhouse prices.  We had a party of five, we all ordered cocktails, beer, and speciality drinks, we ordered two appetizers, and an entree apiece, and yet our waiter tried to upsell us with EVERY. SINGLE. SENTENCE. Look I'm not against the upsell, I get it, but it was just this intense back and forth. For example: Me "I'll get the lettuce wraps" Waiter, "Would you like chicken and shrimp on that? Chicken and shrimp are my personal favorite."  Me "Sure, we'll get chicken and shrimp. And we'll have the BBQ chicken pizza." Waiter, "Ok, would you like bacon and pineapple on that? Those are my personal favorite I'm a huge fan." And everything we ordered was like that. It's like, calm down bud, we're already ordering appetizers and drinks (two rounds) and whatnot, you don't have to go so hard. We aren't being chincy and ordering water for the table. I can only assume this is management's directive which is why I'm not singling out our waiter by name but check yourself CPK, when people come to spend money they want to be treated with respect, not like cheap human beings whom you have to hard sell for every additional dollar. Heck, three of our five person party showed up a few minutes before the rest and we paused at the front door to see if the other two had arrived and a hostess had sprung out of the restaurant asking us if we had any questions about the menu -- calm down now, we're already eating at you establishment, no need to reel us in.  The water and drinks took forever. At least 20 minutes for water. So service was mediocre, and it wasn't busy so no excuse there.  I don't think we'll be back.

Ordered a to go Caesar salad with salmon in it and it was really good.. until I found a curly black hair in a piece of my salmon. Absolutely disgusting, don't make me pay $15 for a salad with freaking hair on it come on dude

The restaurant is clean and very family friendly. My waiter was awesome and he took time to make recommendations.  I had the BBQ chicken pizza with bacon. My daughter had the pepperoni pizza. Both pizzas were good but honestly not the first place that will come to mind when I want pizza.
Had a long day at Disney, came in a bad mood and the service from the iconic Miranda turned my frown upside down!
Lost Togo order. Zero accommodation to make it right. No manger never came Â by or offered anything. Obviously a tourist place so zero customer service

I ordered a to-go a few days ago and when I got back to work I noticed that the salad I bought didn't have anything on it. (Pretty sure the kid that bagged up my order was new, it happens). I called them to let them know I was going to come back and was placed on hold so she could grab someone to help me. I got in my car to drive back and was left on hold the entire time. As I walked up to the counter a guy answered and told me sorry for the wait (30 minutes into it!). I was beyond irritated by this point so I asked for a manager.  The man I spoke to was polite, listen to my complaint and was quick to fix the issue. He explained that the toppings are boxed separately (warm chicken and veggies) and grabbed the two containers that had been left. He asked me if I would like the whole thing redone and guaranteed me that they would figure out what happened for the hold time. He then refunded my ticket. Not one time did he offer an excuse or try to defend what happened. Just heard my complaint, apologized and fixed it.  Driving there I was ready to leave an aweful review (messed up order, 30 minute hold time and a 20 minute drive back so they could fix it). But the professionalism of the manager changed my experience. I've worked in restaurants before and I know mistakes happen it's what's done after that can make it or break it, they did well.  I had never ate there before. Once my salad had all the pieces it was fantastic! I will definitely try it again. Great job changing a cappy situation into something positive! Thank you.

Had Justin as our waiter. We were on a time crunch to get to a reservation. Food was fresh and fast! Drinks were yummy and refilled, bread was hot and refilled and best of all our party of 7 got in and out in under an hour and 15 minutes!

California Pizza Kitchen has the best pizza in town. My husband loves junk food! This is the only place where you can have pizza with out the guilt! All the pizzas are tasty! they are the bomb!!! Only thing... the thin crust pizza is very thin, but still delicious!

Overall, the experience for a Sunday night was good. They seated my friend and I pretty quick considering the families getting out of Disleyland began arriving in droves (a lot of tired, cranky kids and parents). The server was really nice. Our appetizer was GREAT (the friend mac 'n' cheese). My friend ordered the chicken Waldorf salad. He mentioned that they added a bit extra dressing but aside from that it was good. I ordered the avocado egg rolls. I don't know if they changed the recipe but please change it back. I liked the egg rolls with avocado only. They decided to start adding chicken to it. It changes the flavor and the texture. I only ate one egg roll of the three and brought the rest home to my wife. Even she said it was not as good as before. Please bring back the old recipe. This one hiccup was enough to lose two stars.

We came here for lunch since it is close to us and it was great. The avocado egg rolls were delicious and of course the pizza was good. We had the BEST server. Our server was Jordan and he was awesome!!! Having a 3 year old with us can be a challenge, but he was talking to her and super friendly. So thank you Jordan! He is why it's getting such a high score. Good people make all the difference.
KUNG PAO SPAGHETTI!? When did Guy Fieri become a menu consultant at CPK?

Our server was Mark, very attentive! The hostesses treated us within minutes of entering and we waited less than 10 minutes with the amount of people we saw waiting around to get seated they accommodated our party of 2 quickly. Food was awesome as always and the Red Berry Sangria to die for!

I went with a party of 8 and yes, we were a lot but what I noticed is that the same group of people after us was also a party of 8 as well and they got served before us. Another thing, my order was a Cali sandwich which had to have chicken,avocado, bacon and lettuce. But was more lettuce than anything else AND NO BACON added to my sandwich. The waiter came back with some after I had told her and when she brought it I had already finished my sandwich. To top it off, it was COLD bacon. Didn't like it at all. Not the happiest when it came down to my order being messed up completely.

We came in for a family dinner tonight. It's a favorite spot for the family.  Tip: They have a 30 min call ahead list. Totally worth it!!! Once we arrived, we checked in and waited about 10 minutes before our table was ready. I have to say the customer service here was impeccable!!! It was probably the best restaurant experience I've had in a very long time.  Alex was our waiter tonight. It was a busy night and we all knew we would have to be patient. He checked in on us often and made sure we weren't forgotten! He had a great attitude and personable character. He not only highlighted our evening there tonight, but definitely made us want to come back again and again. He deserves a glowing review and certainly earned our loyalty to this location alone.  Keep up the great work!!! We'll be back for more pizza soon!

Results may vary. So me and my friends wanted to go to a near by restaurant that we found was closed for private event so we decided to check out this place. We went and it was busy, it was like 7:30 dinner rush, so yes this might be bad and I don't typically put places on blast but I had a bad time here so now for the main story. We walk in and see someone we know working they suggest the bar so we check it out and see its full except for the end, but we see a table and ask is it cool if we take this unused table and they say no. Then two girls walked up a minute after to the same waitress and they said that it was completely fine. As we Awkwardly sat split on the handicapped bar set up and one at average bar height seat so I'm kinda miffed about that but then that lady took those ladies orders and slipped us, and instead of telling the bartenders to remember us we sat there for ten minutes before someone got us drinks and the ladies got food. Then the server got to us ten minutes after that. Meanwhile we held menus in the air to be served. Honestly disappointed greatly with service, but like I said results may vary.  The salads took around 17 mins with another wait for our silverware. We could have eaten faster if we waited for a table. By the time we started eating the ladies who took the table we were denied were gone. Honestly idk if I will come back to check if it could be any better.

Worst service ever. Came for dinner and we ordered pretty fast after being seated. The waitress brought out 3 of 6 drinks we order and then brought out 2 more. Had to remind them we needed one more. Then after we ordered our food, we had a long wait. They finally brought out 3 of our orders. 2 pastas and a pizza. The pizza was cold. The 2 children in our party did not receive there food until 10 minutes later. The last person never received theirs. Here it is a half hour later and we still have no food!!! Horrible, horrible service!! Do not eat here!!!!

Fail. Â Yes the pizza is pretty good here. Â  The management..not so much. We have been here three times in six years on our visits to Disneyland. They have made mistakes on our order two of those times. Tonight, upon ordering online takeout and specifically checking the box for Truffle Oil for the Mushroom Pizza, which is really the only reason for ordering that pizza, we arrived back at our hotel only to find that we had been charged for it but it was not in the bag. Upon calling we were told that we could walk back for another pizza, otherwise the cost of the Truffle Oil would be refunded. Who, seriously, on vacation, at Disneyland nonetheless, after walking 10+ miles with another early morning and busy day ahead, now wants to spend another 40 minutes walking back and forth to make up for CPK's lack of due diligence? Get it right the first time, or at least refund the price of the personal sized pizza.

Really more like 3.5 stars, but this is the best place to eat within walking distance of Disneyland and many of the hotels in the area. Yes, I know it's a chain, but it's a good, reliable one. The pastas and pizzas are all excellent. Servers are VERY nice and will bend over backwards to make sure you are happy. Decor is nicer than the other CPKs I have been to. The bar wraps around the kitchen, you can watch your pizza get made in their fire oven.

Terrible service, sub-par food- rude and inattentive waiters. We felt ignored the whole time. The waiter Joey did not check back on us and refill our drinks often enough- or ask if we were happy with the food or needed anything.  It took forever to get seated, 4 parties were seated before us, when we arrived before then. And it took a very long time to get the check. We had to ask for it.
I am in love with this place so much! Good food, great service. Highly recommend for the BBQ pizza.

Hmm... quite a few complaints about the food and service here. Either we have been very lucky, or they have read reviews and improved. We have gone twice recently and have had good experiences both times. My husband is on the pizza dough points club and the first time was able to get a free small plate. (Basically an appetizer) We went with the chicken tinga quesadillas. They were tiny, but good. At least it was free. I had gone with the bbq chicken pizza and loved it. My husband had the garlic cream fettuccini. He added chicken (at 2.79 and not much chicken), but boy was it tasty. Great service, on top of drink refills, friendly, gave you all options, etc. We went back recently. This time his pizza dough points had a $10 off $40 or more. Awesome.  Both times I had the frozen raspberry lemonade. (Yummy). This time for a meal I went with the garlic cream fettuccini but I did not add the chicken. My husband had the tostada pizza and added lime chicken for around 1.79 or so. It looked like a gigantic tostada! Great service again. On top of everything. Appetizers were offered but we declined. Recommendations on yummy food items were made, and dessert was offered. We went with the butter cake and added ice cream. A bit pricey, but they weren't chinsy on the size like most places and desserts. Wow! That was deeeeelicious! Now it might be a must item dang it! TRY IT!!!! Both times the food was yummy, and service was great. Hopefully this is always a normal thing from now on.

Our group of 6 visited the this location for the first time tonight on New Years. The restaurant was extremely crowded but the staff was friendly. However, our waiter Jordan is the reason I'm writing this review. He went above and beyond. He was extremely friendly and even though he was insanely busy he mad us feel like we were the only table! He was probably one of the best waiters I've ever had. This guy should be a manager, he was incredible. He just had the best attitude and he was so good at his job and even though it was clearly hectic and he was basically running, he made it seem like such a breeze! He definitely needs to be recognized!
Our go to pizza place when we're visiting Disneyland! The house special is my favorite!

It is a lovely place with an open kitchen. When the General manager heard that it was our first time at CPK she came and gave us a free appetizer, it was really good.  3 of us had spagettie and 1 had a sandwich. And it al was very good and tasty. The waiter Adam Maes (with the Belgian last name) was verry friendly and helpfull. When we said that we come from belgium, he wanted the To learn the dutch word for Thank you. It was a verry Nice evening.

On vacation again for Disney and this restaurant is across the street from my hotel. I ordered a new item...tricolor salad pizza. Since it was take away, the 'breading/pizza' part came in a pizza box while the salad and vinaigrette came in a separate container. The description on the website indicated the pizza crust would be a parmisean crust...I've made one myself before but only used actual parmisean...melted it down and formed a crust like form (thin and crunchy). This pizza however used a very, very, very hard to chew bread with parmisean crumbles on top. I'm not one to complain about bread being chewy...I take home blue bayou bread and eat for 3 days...stale and chewy bread is ok with me but this crust was hard to even tear into smaller pieces in order to crumble on top of the salad. I only ate 1 (ONE!) Slice of the pizza bread and half of it I had to tear up in order to try to enjoy it on top of the salad. My effort was futile because the fork they provided wouldn't penetrate the bread anyway!  Salad was good...seemed 1-2 day old greens. The vinaigrette was ok but they could probably do much better if the tried. If I decide to get a salad again here, I will just ask for a side of red wine vinegar instead. Don't get me wrong...I ate the salad but it was a small amount of greens compared to the size of the crust and I had wished I ordered a plain old salad in the end cause I threw out the remaining crust.  It's a chain restaurant and I don't expect much but you can't expect stars for screwing up pizza breading. I just won't order that item again.

We came here at 9pm and there were four available tables outside. But the hostess ( blond girl) told us "You have to wait about 45minutes for table there are people before you" (no, there were nobody)and I told her - you will close after hour, right. She said " Yes, but we are working tomorrow" , hahaha Anyway we seat ourself and waited for server. After 10minutes he came, take the order and after 30min more he brought the food and that's it. Terrible customer service. We will never go back!

Unfortunately the service at this location was quite poor. This makes me very sad because I love everything about CPK. Their food is so delicious. When we walked in the door was opened for us which was very nice. However, it then took forever to get us seated... when the place was empty. Our server was M.I.A the entire time while we needed refills and asked for bread that was not brought. And, let me say again.... the place was empty. When we finally got bread there weren't even enough pieces for everyone at the table.  I will say that this location does have a great lunch menu on the back. They have options to combine a soup, salad, sandwich, or pizza. This location is also beautiful. There is a great ambiance inside and it really is quite nice. Everything was great except the service, and the service really makes the stay pleasant. Hopefully if you go, you will get a better server and be able to leave a 5 star review.
I loved it. Great place to hang out with friends. We had peperoni pizza and waldruf salad it was delicious. Our server abby was great very attentive.

This was my first time at this particular California Pizza Kitchen location but it was definitely a good one. Â We arrived early as we typically do to beat the dinner rush and were quickly seated inside. Â The server quickly took our drink order and asked if we wanted any appetizers. Â I had recently joined the Pizza Dough club which entitled me to a free small plate. Â Having never used this before the server very nicely showed me how to use the app and check into our location so he could get the three digit code to use for our order. Â  After looking over the options quickly we settled on ordering the spicy chicken tinga quesadilla for our small plate. Â The order quickly came out the presentation was nice and the quesadilla (more like quesadilla bites) were quite good. Â They gave off a very light heat from the ranchito sauce and pepper jack cheese but not enough to bother my wife who really has no tolerance for spicy foods. Â Despite the great flavor these were a bit lacking to me as 4 small bites of quesadilla for 5.49 seems a bit excessive but after all they do call it a small plate and they meant it, lol. For my meal I decided to go with the Garlic Cream Fettucinne with added chicken and was very pleased with the dish. Â The garlic flavor was very nice and the chicken was just enough to add another layer to the overall taste of the dish. Â The fettuccine itself was 10.99 but the chicken was an additional 2.75 so the pricing could be better but it was decent enough for the portion I received. Â I topped off my dish with some parmesan cheese and crushed red pepper flakes. Â I would definitely recommend this dish and will for sure order this again on a future visit. Â My wife had to sample to pasta herself after saying how good it looked and she too approved. Overall we had a pleasant experience here for dinner which I was worried about after reading several reviews regarding terrible service but luckily we experienced none of these issues. Â I am sure we will be back soon as they offer a large and varied menu with several other dishes catching my eye as well. Â Until next time.

Ive been to CPK many times at various locations but tonight my co-workers and I decided to order it through doordash for our lunch break! On this particular night, I order the kids sketti and the kids cheese pizza. Each also came with a kids size soda. The food was scrumptious and very good portion sizes for the price! I am an adult and I will still have leftovers!! My co-workers enjoyed their food as well, one got the dumplings and the other got a couple appetizers. The guy who got the dumplings was raving about how great they were!! Only downside was our doordash taking forever because CPK was extremely busy so they were behind on their orders. He updated us when he was on site waiting for our food. However, there is a convention going on in the area and its a friday night so they were probably slammed.

Wow! Â After a long day at Disneyland we decided to venture out for some pizza. Â We stub led upon this "excellent" pizza place. Â We ordered avocado club egg rolls (OMG good), we then had the Waldorf Chicken Salad and it mirrored the rolls. Â As a final we had some superb pepperoni pizza. Â When I say WOW! Â I mean it. Â The restaurant was very classy and the waitress was fabulous. Â She was friendly and really helped us in our decision with the menu. The atmosphere was awesome... Â A must if you visit Disneyland.

Yuck, what happened to CPK? I grew up eating CPK pizza and loved it. Great memories, great pizza. Recently (though I'm not sure how recently, as I haven't been in about a year), they rolled out a new menu. New starters, new crust, new pizzas. Yuck. Why change something that is good, that people have grown love and expect? Yes, some of the new starters are pretty good. We had the avocado wrap things -- nice, crispy, flavorful -- and the mac and cheese bites. I must've missed where the mac and cheese things were stuffed fried nugget-like things. Nevertheless, they were pretty good, just luke-warm. I wouldn't order them again though, just a strong sense of being fried and clogging my arteries.  My issue comes down to the pizza. Some classic pizzas (like the BLT) are no longer on the menu. And the new dough is TERRIBLE. The pizza was so doughy, it became disgusting. I always finish my pizza, but instead I felt bloated with dough. Also, the dough used to have a slightly sweet taste. This had no flavor. Yuck.  I have no idea why CPK is trying to become something else -- why they are trying to reinvent themselves. If this is what they've decided on for the "new them," then I can see why they were the only restaurant in the GardenWalk that didn't have a wait at 7:30 p.m. on a Friday night.

This place deserves 0 stars. We were celebrating my friends birthday here, we called twice to ensure seating would be ready by the time all of us reached. When some of us arrived, we were told we would have to sit outside because there wasn't enough space inside (they couldn't have told us this when we called??) Anyways, we all sat outside, when it was time to leave and we all had given our credit cards to pay, the lights went out and the machines were unable to charge us. We had to be elsewhere and they forced us to wait until they were able to figure things out. Almost half an hour later, they tell us that they can manually charge our credit cards by writing the info down by hand, so then we had to wait in a long line just to be charged and during this time, others walked out without paying for their meals. At the end, all we got was a weak apology. To top it off, before all this even happened cpk didn't bring any kind of dessert or anything for my friends birthday even though they were aware of the celebration. So honestly would give this place 0 stars if I could. One of the worst experiences I've had at a CPK.

All CPK's have the same food and drinks so the rating is based on the service.. My friend and I had lunch here with our twins (yes, 2 sets of twins.. One set that is 1.5 years old and mine are 5) so that's a total of 2 adults and 4 children. As we check in at the hostess booth, the seems sooooo confused on where to seat us.. I mean, all we requested was for 2 high chairs.. Anyways, no joke, it took them 10 minutes seat us and even when we were seated, the high chairs weren't set up.. Ummm ok.. When we were seated, they didn't even bring the coloring stuff and had to request this.. Anyways.. The food.. Same as always. Good. Service.. I'm going to have to say.. Incompetent team..
great staff, great food try the butter cake with ice cream...

We ordered everything but a pizza, and it all turned out great. With a name like California Pizza Kitchen, I was skeptical that this chain would excel in other dishes besides pizza -- Just saying, it happens. Fortunately, dinner here was a win.  Appetizer - Avocado Club Egg Rolls: It's definitely heavier than the avocado egg rolls served next door at the Cheesecake Factory. Tasty, but rich, due to the chicken, Monterey Jack cheese, bacon, and ranch dip.  Entree - Hearth Roasted Halibut: Delicious I loved the farro and butternut squash. The fish was light, flaky, and had a clean flavor. Our server confessed he recently started and apologized for any missteps. He did a great job. Service ran smoothly and he was attentive to our table.  The area its located in is one big Mouse (tourist) Trap, but CPK is a restaurant that I would return to. The food and service didn't disappoint.

Fantastic service and very attentive to refills, orders, etc... We came on a Wednesday night but it was busy because of the conventions so there was about a 20 minute wait to be seated but everything from start to finish was well cared for. We got to take advantage of their Valentine's Day special which ran for about 5 days or so. Portions are good sized and food was great.

My wife and I went here for the first time yesterday we had the classic pizza with a salad and Â two glasses (each LOL) of Sangria. The pizza was very good. Just the way a California pizza should taste. Our waitress was very attentive and was taking care of our needs all night. This was our first time eating and drinking here but it definitely will not be our last trip to the California Pizza Kitchen.

food is amazing as always. No matter which California Pizza Kitchen I go to the food is consistent, tasty, delicious. our waiter on this round was slow. he wasn't too good. didn't clear off table. took too go long to take order. and just made rhe experience meh. but Kung pao spaghetti was delicious and we keep coming back for it.
Had a great time here, we were seated immediately, and offered drinks. I had the Thai salad which was huge, husband got a pizza. Reasonably priced for the area, and they will validate your parking.

We had a great time, service was rock solid. Â Food was remarkably good. CPK has seriously reinvented themselves. Â The half house salad (off menu) with Dijon Vinaigrette is stellar. My pal had creamy garlic pasta with chicken, which was done with excellence. Â Their appetizer 3 kinds of tortilla rolls thing was good. The flavor of the sauces out standing. The bread and oil started is great too. No complaints. They do validate but only for 1 hour.
Must be nice to be a bar tender or manager and get free alcoholic drinks on a To go cup as you work
Love their Wild Mushroom w/ grilled chicken and roasted garlic. Â Also, their Roasted vegetable salad and their Ribeye Steak! Â Great for parties and great selection of beers and cocktails

Everything was terrible and I really mean it the server spilt my beer on my moms legs and my back he apologized but the problem wasn't that it was the service later on was so bad and the manager didn't even try to apologize to us when the check came in he said I'm sorry but the only thing can I do for you guys is give you the 20% off just on the food SERIOUSLY! I mean I wasn't looking for a discount I was looking for at least an apology from the manager... I'm really disappointed it just to be one of my favorite restaurant but I dont think I'm coming back again...

I had the WORST experience I may have ever had at any restaurant at this location. We got to the restaurant at 4:45pm (based on our parking structure ticket), and didn't get to leave until 6:15pm. Then he brought our food, and we had to ask for a second plate, since we were sharing a dish, and ranch. Mind you, we had asked for this second plate when we placed the order, since we were sharing. He came back about 7 minutes later with JUST THE RANCH. We asked for a plate AGAIN, and he brought it back in a few minutes. The chicken in the kids plate we ordered was stringy and gristly, and we wanted to let the server know, but he NEVER came back to check on us. As the other part of my party went to the restroom, twice with the little one, the server was spotted standing at the end of the bar, counting his money and chatting with a fellow employee. As I went to the restroom, I saw the same thing. So three times he was spotted in the same place, NOT checking on us. As someone who's worked in the restaurant industry before, this is terrible customer service, and unacceptable if you ask me.

The service was amazing. There was a marathon going on at Disney so it was very busy and the team was doing an amazing job to get to everyone. Sarah was our waitress and was doing her best to keep up. Adam was the manager who took care of our bill after waiting for so long. Despite the wait, I was very pleased and flattered thanks to the service and the exquisite dinner we received. Thank you ! Keep up the good work.

It was an unfortunate event in which the power went out while we were eating dinner, but the staff handled the situation very poorly. First, the waitress told the table that since the power was out, our food would be free (she said this to multiple tables). Second, multiple individuals in the party were charged incorrect amounts, and when calling to inquire about the charges, myself included, were treated as inferior and not with respect. Management continually repeated that it was not their fault without trying resolve the situation. Overall, very disappointed with the service received and will not frequent the establishment again.

We had a party of 12 and 3 kids. We were celebrating my nephew's party. If you get Alex as your server, Â good luck. He seemed a bit frazzled, maybe because we had a big party? But the place was empty. We arrived at 430pm and the place was dead. As he served everyone else drinks in my party (I came 5 min later than everyone else) I asked for a sprite and water. He said he needed to tend to his other customers before he could get to me. Like he was busy or something. I kid you not, I saw one guy on his laptop, and a mother with her baby. We also asked for extra bread cuz he only served 2 small plates of bread to a party of 15. Anyway, whatever you do, don't order the fusili alfredo on the kids menu. There's nothing in it. They literally serve you cooked noodles that are naked. Maybe there is a teaspoon of what looks like milk. Not even cream, lol. I asked Alex if this how it always looks. He said that their recipe calls for light sauce. (Which is literally a teaspoon of milk.) He gave us extra sauce on the side. Too bad the consistency was of milk. I took the rest home since my son only took 3 bites. I'll have to jazz it up myself with some real sauce, lol. So if you enjoy CPK, I recommend Brea or Irvine. Otherwise, make it yourself.

Had a great lunchtime experience. The Bianco flatbread was really good and the crispy Mac and cheese is something I will absolutely order again. They were rolled into crispy balls and fried. Not was I was expecting but I was pleasantly surprised. Our server Justin did everything right, his timing and attitude were perfect and he was very helpful.

In town for the Tink Half Marathon at Disneyland, and after a long travel day I was STARVING! A few blocks from the hotel, we headed to CPK for a late lunch. The restaurant was quiet at 3pm on a Friday, but our waitress was friendly and sweet. I had a tasty fruit mojito and the Hawaiian (my regular), and it was just about perfection! We had bread for the table, which I haven't seen in awhile! Who doesn't love bread? Especially on vacation? Really, a lovely and relaxing late afternoon of good food on vacation!.

Normally I don't leave negative reviews but this CPK location has horrible service. It took over an hour to get our food. There were 3 adults and a child (under 2yro) in our party. Our server never came around to apologize for the delay, never came around to offer us drink refills, never asked if we needed anything like more bread or an appetizer. I over heard another sever say they were short staffed but still no excuse. When our food did come, server never asked how it was or checked on us. Never offered dessert. Overall I would never go back to this CPK.

This place has the coolest workers. Â I wanted Sicilian pizza and the worker recommended Jamaican jerk pizza. She said: you can get half and half. The half and half pizza was not as good as the one from DTLA location but I liked my BBQ chicken salad with avocado on the side. The host was super nice too. 3 stars!! CPK @ Anaheim is almost yummylicious!!

Ambiance : I went here for a friend's birthday party around lunch time on a Sunday. It's a good place for large parties since there's much space between tables, allowing staff to push them together if necessary. It has a nice cool feeling inside with concrete floors and warm colors. When we were there it was at a nice noise level. Food : I showed up at the end for the best part. Dessert of course haha. From what I saw on the plates, portions were American and large. Everyone seemed to enjoy it.  Service : While I was there the service was pretty good, however they didn't even address me. Either they didn't notice that their table had a new person or they didn't care. Either way that wasn't good. They did bring out fresh dessert plates for everyone without asking so a positive note.

I've come here several times before and had pretty good service. My last visit was on Thursday. It was not busy at all.  The waitress was rather inattentive. Â I had to find her and ask her for basic things like silverware, plates and bread. Once she took our order she disappeared. I asked another waitress to go get her so we can get our bill and some boxes to go. I gave her my pizza dough number and she never even added it to my bill. It was kind of frustrating.

Worst CPK I've ever been to. I've given this place so many chances, and I've been disappointed every single time. The service is the worst I've ever experienced. The last time my fiancÃ© and I came, they took my name and said there would be a wait, even though there were plenty of tables that were vacant and no one was waiting. Once we were seated, it took a long time for anyone to even acknowledge us. After we got our food, our waitress never came back. We needed refills on our drinks and she was nowhere to be found. When we were ready for the check, our waitress didn't seem to know how to operate the register. This is the closest CPK to me, but I'll drive further just to avoid this place!

The service at this location was horrible. Serve:r Malissa D  The server seemed like she was being over worked and just wanted to leave. She didn't show one smile and looked annoyed whenever we asked her a question or for something. I was looking around for her to ask for some more water, and I was her sitting by the back register... I was not sure if she was on break but she made herself unavailable to her customers.  The avocado club roll was BOMB. It was different from just having avocados inside like BJs did. The fire roasted chile relleno was tasty and savory also. The California club pizza on the other hand... not worth $14. It was just dry and bland. I had to ask for three different dipping sauce to make it taste better. Overall, I have experienced better service and food at another CPK location.

For a restaurant close to Disneyland, it was pretty good. I had a Hawaiian pizza and was disappointed in how skimpy the toppings were. Only 1-2 pieces of pineapple per slice, and almost no cheese at all.

Recently here when my family and I visited Disneyland. It was very close to our hotel, so we just walked. Â We had Erika as a server and arrived at what looked like a slow-time. We ordered: White corn guac appetizer 1 pizza -1/2 chipotle chicken -1/2 spicy pulled pork 1 kids mac&cheese 1butter cake for dessert Everything was delicious. I would recommend the chipotle chicken pizza over the pulled pork...but my hubs would do the opposite. Our daughter couldn't finish her mac&cheese, it's probably enough for two 3 year olds. The butter cake was so good, big enough for all 3 of us to enjoy.  My only complaint would be the time. It seemed to take quite a long time to get everything. Our server checked on us a lot, and told us they had some new hires in the kitchen. But when our food got delivered the kids meal was just warm...making me think it was sitting around for a little while, while our kid was hungry and whining :/  Overall it was a good experience and Erika was great.
Good standard CPK experience. Nice to have real food fairly close to the park.

I love the pepperoni / mushroom / sausage pizza!!! It is so tasteful. We ordered a pizza half of that and half of the famous BBQ chicken pizza. Lemonade unlimited refill is a plus. Waiters / waitresses frequented us and were very professional. They offered us a free flatbread pizza sample since it was our first visit there. But dirty silverware w/ stains on it was really a bum... the 'backend' staff should really pay attention to details.

This location is located in "The Shops at Gardenwalk". Probably the nicest looking California Pizza Kitchens that I have ever been to. We walked in and was welcomed immediately by the hostess. As she walked us to our table, she asked us what we had planned to start a light conversation.  A short moment later our waitress arrived. She was very nice, handed the menus to us and gave us a few moments to figure out what to order.  The person who started serving our food was the manager. He was nice and professional. The avocado spring rolls are the best appetizers they have. Try them if you have not already. As for the pizza, it is good and filling. After we got our food, our waitress checked on us at times just to make sure we needed anything. The only reason why I didn't give this place five-stars is because the waitress forgot to get my girlfriend's Coke. At least it didn't appear in the bill.

CPK, good stuff if you go in with the "Californian Pizza" mindset. Been going to CPK for 20 years now and watched them grow as a restaurant (their menu). However, I've also watched their food size shrink :-) Still a great place for a salad and an interesting pizza. Can't really go wrong in my opinion.

One of the worse place I ate, We arrive at 7:00pm with two small kids and a baby, it took us around 10 minutes to choice and order, but we didn't get the food before 8:00pm and this after we asked twice about it. Then we got the food, the kids pizza was cool, the salmon was over cook, the soup was lukewarm,  We mention to the waiter that it took the food a long time to arrives, we got a response that actually call us liars Because we didn't have a lot of options (because the kids) we ate the food The waiter told us she will call the manager we waited 10 minutes but he didn't arrived so we pay the bill and left and will never eat at this chain again (Of course we didn't left tip for this lousy service)

Our family are huge CPK fans but this was the best experience we've had in years. The highlight of our experience was our server Devon. He was extremely attentive, friendly, polite and efficient. Most importantly, he went out of his way to anticipate our needs before we even asked. The food was also universally excellent. For appetizers, we ordered the quesadillas, arugula salad and "2 in a bowl" split pea and chicken tortilla soup. We highly recommend them all. Turning to our main dishes, the White Pizza with four cheeses and Applewood Bacon was unbelievably delicious. Their bacon has the best texture and flavor that we've ever had.  We also ordered their signature Chicken Tequila Fettuccine which is surprisingly light and tangy. The Tostada thin crust pizza was scrumptious and the Grilled Chicken Chimichurri on their lite menu was very flavorful with the vegetables cooked just right so they were still a little crunchy.  This was a perfect 19th birthday dinner for our son. Thank you CPK!

Only my second time going to a CPK. It's a franchise so it was just like the other one in Sacramento. Â Busy establishment and friendly service. Â I guess what they are famous for is their crazy pizza toppings. We had a pizza with lettuce and avocados. Â My toppings fell off both slices I tried to put on my plate. Â I do not recommend whatever the heck version of pizza it was called. Â The crust was decent but I like to taste my toppings. Â Maybe try a pizza without lettuce snd you will get a slice of pie into your mouth. Â Just a tip

Great energy here! Really hard to walk into a busy restaurant and every single employee has a positive energy and great work ethic towards each other and just being on top of their "a" game. Foods amazing and this place is ran the way a successful business should be ran.

Several problems today. First, I work weekends and I decided to take lunch here. I was looking forward to the lunch sized pizza and salad combo. After waiting nearly 15 minutes to even get a Coke I placed my order and the waitress said "no." Â Excuse me! Â I explained the only reason I came in there was to get a small size lunch since I was on lunch. She explained that it was only Monday to Friday. I accept that. However, I don't accept waiting 15 minutes to even see the server and then be treated so flippantly. I was hoping she would make another suggestion to me but nothing. I left. To put off with the painfully slow service and this place is terrible. I am actually really surprised since I have eaten at other California Pizza's before.
Great pizza , service was really good as well, good location close to our hotel, definitely recommended

I like this place, it's pretty solid.  Good service, good food, clean!  I had a flatbread small bite pizza. It had mushrooms and spinach and also a small field green salads. It was light yet satisfied me appetit. They serve these small bread bites with dipping sauce.
Ordered a Hawaiian Pizza, it was a bit under cooked. Â Sharon, the waitress, was friendly and service was great.

Came here with my wife and kids, my wife ordered a Quinoa + Arugula salad, before enjoying the salad, she was looking through it and discovered a dead green insect. Disgusting...Fearing my salad had dead insects, I couldn't even eat my BBQ chicken salad. The staff was apologetic, and offered something else. I would never return unless I was going to dine with my pet iguana, who doesn't even like dead insects. If I can give negative stars I would.

Haven't been to CPK for a while. Look's like they changed up the menu a little bit. Things look a lot fresher now!  This place was pretty popping the day I came. I imagine it must always be like that seeing as that location seems busy. So let's get into it! Service: 4/5 -dude that was serving us was friendly and attentive -could tell he was trying pretty hard to provide a good dining experience -he made a couple mistakes like bringing me out the wrong drink or selling us on an appetizer that was no longer available but nothing serious Food: 3/5  -Started off with a mushroom flat bread appetizer and it was pretty good! -Wasn't really feeling like pizza seeing as I had pizza earlier that week so I went with the garlic fettucini alfredo and it was just ok to me. I think it could've used more sauce and the noodles were just slightly a little too al dente for me -love the free bread with herb oil. I think I ate like 4-5 pieces of bread which is why I didn't finish my pasta we all pretty much know what cpk is about. another chain restaurant. what more can I say?

Place is great for lunch as the crowds are at a minimum. However the staff sort of lacks initiative or urgency when it comes to table service. Don't get me wrong they are great people, friendly & aware. But the awareness is what bothers me a tad bit. Just wish they are a bit more attentive and consistent with their customer table service.  My family and friends pretty much ordered the pasta plates whereas I ordered the Ciabatta Club sandwich with salad. What is funny is that all the pasta plates including the kids meal all arrived around the same time from one another. My meal however, the sandwich and salad, arrived 5 minutes later. The easiest meal to make & it arrives last and late.  Observations about the staff. The Greeter, some lady, loves to chit chat in the back with the staff. Rest of the Male Waiters try their best to keep up with the customers and their orders. My waiter was cool but it seems something was on his mind. There was this group who kept raising their hands to place their orders and was later served. So either they know that the Lunchtime crowd is slow or today was just one of those lazy days for the entire staff.  Maybe later this week I'll go their for dinner and see if there is a difference between the two staffs. The food is great and there were no complaints from anyone. Especially me as overall this is my 3rd time eating at California Pizza Kitchen since it was first introduced in Santa Clara Valley.  Well that is it for now.

Eggrolls and bbq chicken pizza are good. Other pizzaa are ordinary. But their jambalaya spaghetti.... sucks I left the whole dish after eating one bite. Other spaghetti like chicken alfredo... are ordinary. i gave three stars for its ordinariness.

Pretty darn nice CPK. Came in for lunch just for a salad and had great service and a delicious salad. Nice environment. No complaints at all. If I am in the area (god forbid, because I hate Anaheim), I will be back.

My first experience at CPK was horrible and I never went back. Â Teriyaki chicken pizza was horrible! C'mon! Teriyaki paste!?  Maggie Â C Â convinced Â me to give Â CPK another chance. My bbq chicken salad and Jamaican Jerk pizza were delicious (Sydney our waitress  was great and recommended getting half Jerk chicken and half Sicilian pizza. Â Didn't know you can do half half.). Gluten & Dairy Free!! I haven't gone to a cpk in years, since before my gluten/dairy free lifestyle. They are GIG approved so I had to try it. It did not disappoint, they had a gig approved menu. I ordered the mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza with no cheese. It was really good, the crust a little on the sweet side but good. And I didn't get sick! The manager brought out the pizza and it had a little certified Gluten free stick in it. They have other gluten free items but they can't certify GF. If your as sensitive as me to cross contamination stick with the GIG menu. Also they offer crisp in GF cider. Below ill copy and past from   about what makes it gig approved:  1) The Gluten Intolerance Group of North American (GIG) certifies restaurants that use the strict procedures approved by GIG. There are currently four "GIG certified" items on the CPK menu. They include the pizzas listed on the small menu above: GF Margherita, GF Chicken Barbecue, GF Mushroom Pepperoni Pizza and GF Pepperoni. 2) To be a "GIG certified" GF menu item at CPK, the food must be prepared in the new GF dedicated part of the kitchen and all of the ingredients used on the pizza must be from that dedicated area. For example, I requested goat cheese on my son's pizza since we don't do cow' milk cheese. They could not certify his pizza because the goat cheese comes from another part of the kitchen that is not certified. 3) You can order a different style pizza not listed on the above menu with the GF crust, but it will not be "GIG certified." 4) They use a blue sticker as seen below to seal all pizzas that are considered "certified." 5) The manager is supposed to deliver any certified GF pizza. It is to be delivered upon completion, even if it's done before the rest of the table's food so that it does not sit around and potentially become contaminated with flour/gluten. The manager is also supposed to wash his/her hands before handling the pizza. 6) There are other menu items listed as "GF" on their regular menu. These dishes are not considered "GIG certified." They are free of gluten ingredients but are not prepared in the dedicated part of the kitchen. The white corn guacamole and chips listed on the menu below is an example of this. This basically means that the dish is free of gluten ingredients but they cannot guarantee against cross contamination of gluten. I have inquired with CPK as to whether the chips are fried in dedicated oil but have not heard back yet. 7) CPK now uses rice flour to work all their pizza dough including wheat flour dough. This prevents the very small airborne flour molecules from contaminating the dedicated part of the kitchen.

Okay, CPK red velvet cake is amazing. Took my Daughter and Granddaughter (Age 4) to CPK one Saturday for Lunch in the not to distance past to this great Joint in the Anaheim Garden Walk. We knew what to expect since this is a chain, but this location did not disappoint. Â It is located in the Anaheim Ctywalk area. The restaurant can get very busy. yummy food, a make shift happy hour but good before a night at the clubs.

terrible pizza...i ordered the margharita to go..burnt! Â cheese burnt...it was like hard cardboard...gross!
