Ahem, please prepare for a long rant ahead... I have visited this location about 4 times since it has opened. Out of the 4, 1 was disappointing and the other made me a little angry. The first time I was disappointed was when my church friends and I visited for dinner. The sun was setting and it was shining into the restaurant. The host wanted to sit us directly in the sunlight which I did not want therefore I asked her to sit us somewhere else. She hesitated and acted like she almost did not want to see us anywhere except in the direct sunlight which baffled me because the restaurant was wide open. After some thought she moved us out of the sunlight, dispairingly. Now this most recent experience, last Friday night to be exact, was a little more upsetting. My sister decided to have her rehearsal dinner at this location because it was down the street from our church in addition to the fact that everyone likes CPK. She made reservations for our group at 7 p.m. Well the wedding rehearsal ran a little late so we called them and asked to push back our reservation to 7:30 p.m. which they said was fine. Again there were some delays so we called CPK again and apologized and inquired if we could push our reservation back to 8 p.m. which they said was fine. Our party arrived a little before 8 p.m. only to find out that they had moved our reservation outdoors onto the patio when we had reservations for inside the dining room. It was freezing cold Friday night but what got us was the fact that they decided, on their own, to move our party outside. I understand that they got busy but they did not give us any notice, not in the two times that we phoned them. Maybe if they would have informed us we would have been prepared and understanding but at that moment and time, all of us were not happy about it. That manager just gave us some excuses and informed us, yea they could have called us with an attitude of (but its too late so what are we suppose to do). The hostess was more professional then the manager of the restaurant. They ended up seating us separately. The attitude of the manager was very unapologetic and unprofessional. She did not even come to apologize to our party and just seemed to want to get us away from the front area of the restaurant. This last visit will be my last visit to this location and I shall not be returning.

After getting seated we showed the yelp coupon of $10 off $40. After doing so we sat arround as our confused waitress blatently ignored us. So we are off to a super crappy start to dinner. Manager finally came by to explain how the coupon worked. I told him we know how they work its your waitress who is confused and ignoring us now. 20 minutes since showing a stupid coupon and we can finally order water. Finally got to order 30 mins after arrival. Sure glad that coupon through yelp was easy to use. Its 15 mins later and twice food not belonging to us has been delivered and here we wait no food. 50 mins since entering no food that was ordered 20 mins ago. Its wednesday with less than half the tables filled. We ordered a pizza and pasta. It would be less headache to go home and make it myself. So far the most awful service I have had in years. If you get the misfortune of comming here for dinner try for the view of the brick oven. I just watched a pizza burn to a crisp. At no time did anyone even notice. It was probably mine. Well at 1 hour 5 mins the manger brought our food. Still waiting for my tea refill from 25 mins ago. Food at least looks good. My wifes spaghetti bolognese with sauce has a ton of pasta and a tiny amount of sauce...tiny. I ordered the jambalaya fettucini. Its very tasty overall. I just do not like tails on shimp in pasta. We also shared a hand tossed pepperoni mushroom sausage pizza. The crust is outstanding. It should be called two handfuls of mushrooms a couple pepperonis and 3 sausage chunks pizza. . Great crust. We will be taking the red velvet cake home. Well maybe. It was forgoten it seems. So reordering that. Now it seems the coupon was not used the waitress is confused and here we wait on the manager once again. So no. Cake and overcharged about $20. So far... well on my 4th receipt. All were wrong. Now up at the take out with manager tring to fix the ticket and add the missing red velvet cake to the bill. Who knows we might actually get it sometime tonight to take home. A complete waste of 1 hour 30 mins. Still waiting for the bill and cake. Got bill now can not pay the stupid thing. Screw the cake take the money so I can leave this........................finally was able to pay the bill revised by the manager for the 6th time. I paid cash and I guess the waitress assumed the change was her tip since she never came back with my change. I was gojng for no tip but she decieded to keep the $2 and change so be it. After asking 3 other people not my waitress or the manager who went into hiding I got the cake that was partially melted. From walk in the door and seated to finally forcing them to let me pay so I could leave to 1 hour 53 minutes. Should have taken 25-30 mins max. Will never eat there or at any of the chains ever again.

first off i would always get my bread toasted but all of a sudden they tell me they cant because it slows down the time it takes them to make their pizzas? i call BS. Â but whatevers.. they are just too lazy to do it.. thats just what i think.. other then that i like this location a lot. Â i like to go right when they open to avoid any crazy waits or it being busy since they do get a lot of tourist and business people here. Â  i love their salads! the chinese one, thai, cobb, and bbq chicken ones are my favorite.. im always battling and debating which one i should get! Â prices are high for what you get. thats for sure. but i only go once in awhile so its ok.. lol service is good.. sometimes it is lacking and they hide in the back or something.. kind of lame especially when you are trying to get their attention and they are no where to be seen.. annoying.. other then that great place for lunch or dinner! good service. and VALIDATE THAT PARKING TICKET!

I love the service here! We were planning on going to the Cheesecake factory, but it was full so we went to CPK instead and I'm glad we did!  My uncle got a special "icecream" for his birthday,and their pizza is perfection. If your a pizza lover like me, you probably know what perfection means. The service is freindly, our waiter was very nice, and the food came in the blink of an eye.

I honestly don't have ANYTHING to complain about this place! We got some dumplings for appetizers, shared a Thai Chicken Pizza (DELICIOUSS), had one of the sangrias, and the RED VELVET CAAKE. At first, we thought that the sangria wouldn't be such a great idea for brunch ... but it went perfect with our meal! I haaave to learn how they do the vanilla bean cream cheese frosting for the red velvet cake. It was really nice inside and our server was very professional. He suggested his favorite items for each section of the menu & refilled my bf's water as soon as he finished it. Although this location is in Anaheim, I hope the San Diego ones won't change my opinion about cpk! Hahahahaha. =P

The food was good but our waitress was horrible! Â We were seated for over 10 minutes before she even asked us if we wanted water! Â When she finally comes she is coughing the whole time. Every time we wanted something we had wait to she was no where around. Â They were really busy, I think they needed more waitress.

My wife and I are regulars to this location, so it's only fitting that I put in a review for the locals. The restaurant is next to Disneyland and as such tends to attract many, many tourists. Â This is why there is usually a wait and most of the people waiting look like they are from the Midwest. That's the main reason we bypass everyone and sit in our usual spot at the bar. Â The bar staff are friendly, funny and extremely fast when it comes to providing drinks and the food. Â I also found that bar staff tend to be the most honest when it comes to dish opinions and meal suggestions. This location in particular, is great for locals because after seeing tourists come in from opening to close, they tend to treat locals a little bit nicer. Â Go, if you are in the area. Â This is one CPK that you won't go wrong with.
Terrible service. Don't ever put in a to-go order and expect them to get it right or have it be ready within 45 min!

I really love CPK. I do. I can't help it...but this location was a disappointment. I called in my order to go, "2 carne asada pizzas, table bread, and an OBSCENE amount of ranch, Please" the girl on the line giggled and said "Ok, it'll be ready in about 15-20" My boyfriend went and picked it up and brought it back and when we got ready to eat, we realized, no bread, and about the equivalent to 4 tablespoons of ranch. (It's TO DIE FOR, if you've never had it. It isn't a thick sweet ranch, it's got a TON of herbs and flavors to it. - You'll thank me) Oh, and our food was cold. I just LOVE microwaving my food. Not only did they forget 2 out of 4 things I ordered, it took about THIRTY minutes for the order to be ready.  I guessssss next time, I'll have to do the pick up and inspect every item before I bring it home. I know...I know...we should all do that but it shouldn't excuse their incompetence.

After a morning of being at the Dental Convention, we thought we deserved a beer and some pizza! Â It was about 12:30 on a Friday and it was pretty empty for lunch I had the lunch special and choose the half salad and pizza- I asked if they had gluten free crust and she mentioned that they only have gluten free for the regular size, not the lunch size which is probably the personal size. When I think of CPK, BBQ chix pizza is the thing that pops to mind. Â People always talk about it yet all these times I've been, I've never tried it BUT today was the day for that to change! Â There was a good amount of Caesar salad although I was given barely any dressing. It was enough to coat the top portion of it and I was too lazy to ask for more because I wanted to dig into my BBQ chix pizza. Â It was pretty darn good- crust was thin and yet fluffy at the same time? if that makes any sense- it had just the right sweetness from the BBQ sauce but not overwhelming. Â  There just SO many different pizza places out there, I don't think I would go out of my way to order it from here.

location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: I'll give it 2.5 stars. I came here with a couple of friends around 10PM on a Friday night. The server was nice but the service was severely lacking. It took awhile before the server came to take our order. When one of the girls in our group was going to order a veggie soup, he straight up told her to not get that because it tastes disgusting. He recommended a different soup instead. I ordered a Thai Chicken pizza with no peanuts on top (I'm not allergic but just don't like peanuts). Even though I specifically requested no peanuts on top of the pizza, when my order came out...there were peanuts on my pizza.... Throughout the entire time when we were eating, he never once came by to refill our waters. The only time he asked if we wanted water was when he gave us our check. Granted he was the only server on the floor, but besides us there were only 2 other tables that he was serving. We were not pleased with our experience here.

I'm from the Bay Area and I can deal with the coldness but when it comes to a restaurant, it should be warm and welcoming. I am literally wearing my NorthFace jacket with my hood on and it seems like no one bothered to notice. When I was leaving I also noticed a little kid doing the same thing as I was with the hood on. I even told a server that it is freezing in here and her response to me was "it's always cold in here." Can I just say WOW. It's warmer outside then in.

Really enjoyed this location! Came here during the CDA with my bestie and mommy. Our server was so kind and considering how busy the entire area was at the time they were pretty fast and on top of things!  Food was yummy and didn't disappoint. We enjoyed the bbq pizza, Cobb salad & lettuce wraps! All were delish!

Our group of 8 appeared 20 mins before closing time (we didn't know that then). Staff was very friendly! Jordan, our server was awesome!!! We felt horrible having to keep him and the rest of the staff late. Jordan made us feel very comfortable and told us not to worry. He was genuine, kind, FUNNY and treated us wonderfully! Food was delicious, all orders were correct, drinks were refilled! A wonderful experience! Thank you for being so NICE and understanding! The service tonight exceeded expectations!

Pretty disappointed. After a 90 minute wait we were finally seated. Waited another 20 minutes before we were given menus.  What a disorganized mess. When the server told us it would be at least another 30 minutes before we got our food we called it a loss and walked out.

Our server Josh was absolutely amazing! He always checked on us and had a great personality. The food came out very fast and was fresh and delicious. We came on a Wednesday around 5 and there was no wait. The entire staff is amazing and I totally recommend coming here.

Ordered to go via DoorDash. Order was 30 min later than quoted (not DoorDash's) fault. Food arrived. I ordered spaghetti bolognese and kids fusilli with meat sauce. There was maybe one tablespoon of sauce on each dish. Nothing like eating dry pasta. To top it off, I called to speak with the manager. After being on hold for 30 minutes I gave up. Horrible food. Horrible service. Never again.

We came on New Year's Day, and were happy to find that they were open... BUT it took us an hour to get our food. Â The place was pretty empty, so not sure why service was non-existent (I guess nobody wanted to be there that day?)... and not sure why it took so long to get our food! Â We ordered simple stuff like sandwiches, lettuce wraps, and some mac 'n cheese for the kids.

My boyfriend just walked to the restaurant to pick up our order and walked back and I woke up from my nap to eat my cheese pizza with artichoke hearts on it, but after opening I see that it's actually ham, pineapple, and artichoke hearts. Pineapple and ham would be my least favorite pizza toppings.

The pizza here is always fresh and super tasty! Especially their barbecue chicken, one of my faves! My boyfriend had the barbecue chicken and I had the Jambalaya fettuccine, it was good as well.  Samantha (Sam) was our waiter! She was quick and super sweet! She took our orders w/ out even writing it down and in just a couple of minutes, our food was out! Â She came back w/ a second round of drinks for us w/ out us even asking! The food was great and the service was even better!

Took 10 minutes for someone to help. Order was supposed to be ready at 12:45. Got there at 1, and they had to look for the food for 13 minutes.....  Get home with my food. Order is wrong. Also, pizza is incredibly small for price. Get it together.

This is my go to restaurant for CPK, it is close to Disneyland and is never really over a 30 minute wait. Last night our server Sara was on top of her game last night, we had told her we had a movie to catch in literally 1 hour from the time we sat down and she was able to get our order in and always made sure we had water to drink and bread to munch on while we waited. Pizza came out hot and fresh like usual and as soon as the pizza hit the table she asked if we would like to pay so that we don't have to wait on her. We were able to make our movie in Downtown Disney with about 5 minutes to spare, very happy with this location at all times

We ate here after our second day of DisneyLand. Arrived at 530 on a Thursday, wasn't crowded at all; promptly greeted and sat. We each ordered a cocktail wine and a beer. Each cold and tasted great.  To eat we had the bbq chicken salad and tostada pizza. We added avo to the salad which was a nice touch. Well portioned and fresh. We both enjoyed that. The pizza was thin crust. My wife loves this pizza; I thought it was kinda bland. With that being said I did eat two pieces. I would prefer a more traditional pizza. The service was solid, restaurant was clean. For a chain restaurant this is a safe choice, post DLand it's a great choice. Cheers.

This has got to be the worst service i've ever received! Usually the staff is very well with handling the late lunch hour. I got there about 1:50pm and there weren't a whole lot of people in the place. It took about 20 minutes to be seated and didn't even bring my drinks out until I asked the waiter to bring them out. Let alone, I had to wait another 10 minutes to order. By that time it was about 2:35. Around 3:00 o'clock I asked about my food and told me it should be coming out shortly. It didn't..by the time I got my food it was half cold and untouchable. Worst service in a California Pizza Kitchen i've ever experienced.

Our main stop for dinner... not only when we arrived in Anaheim from Hayward but once before we left.... When you think of a name like California Pizza Kitchen, you think the only thing they make is pizza, right? Wrong! They have all kinds of things on the menu. I had the chicken strips and my boyfriend had a few slices of pizza. Of course, no dinner is complete without a beer so I had one at Dinner. It is a considerable walk from WorldMark but was one of the better choices we saw for dinner compared to some of the other areas we scoped out on the Yelp app. I'm a fan.

I'm not sure if this review could be applied to all CPK's nowadays or just this location. But after visiting here, I wondered if the food quality at CPK's have lowered drastically over the years--or if this location just doesn't feel the need to put effort into their food, because they know people will inevitably stop by due to Disneyland.  Me and my sister shared a Bolognese using Fusili pasta with added mushrooms. It was our favorite dish growing up because of the meaty sauce with cheese. For years we would go every week or so with our family and order that exact dish off of the kids menu. (You would think we would've thought to try the pizza first.)  We were excited to order it again after such a long time, but the dish we got was a disappointing shadow of the one we remembered. There was barely any meat in the sauce, and even less cheese. The only thing done right was the pasta itself--cooked al dente. Well done, California Pizza Kitchen, well done... My sister thought it was her cold preventing her from tasting much flavor, but after trying some salt she confirmed it was just the blandness of the Bolognese. She felt like she could've made the dish she had gotten at home. Knowing her, I knew she could've made something better. The only reason why this review isn't sporting two stars instead of three is because the quality of other dishes we got (Thai Crunch salad, BBQ Chicken Pizza, some-lemon-Chicken-dish-I-forgot, and chocolate soufflÃ© a la mode) were not bad Tldr; we paid $15-16 dollars for a mediocre dish--there seem to be some fair choices on the menu, but choose wisely.

I do think CPK has stepped up their game a bit. Plenty of menu options besides just pizza, healthy offerings as well. I enjoy their soups and salads and even the salmon here was pretty good. Service was fine, food came out quickly. Portions are descent, but it is a bit pricey for chain restaurant food. Clean restaurant with plenty of seating, descent food but not worth going out of my way to return.

We came here for dinner on a Saturday night with a group of 9 and were seated under five minutes. Not sure if that was a miracle, or they're just really well staffed and have tons of space for large parties. A number of individuals in our party had allergies towards onion and garlic and our server, Joseph, checked with the kitchen to see what could be done to accommodate. We ended up ordering five pizzas, two of the wild mushrooms, one of the California veggie, one of the tostasa, and one of the artichoke spinach. Everything was absolutely delicious! Ambiance for the location is comfortably lit, great for family and groups of friends. It was a bit loud at times, but that's to be expected. Free bread is provided throughout the meal, so if you're hungry and having a hard time deciding, munch on that in the meantime. Not many of us ordered drinks, but those who did said they enjoyed it. Overall, super great experience and we would totally go back whenever we're in town next!!

We had a wonderful experience here! The manager and staff were all so nice, patient and on top of things. We had 6 kids ranging from 5-13 and 4 adults. We didn't have to wait long to get seated, to order or to get our food. The kids menu has lots of different options and they left happy. It was very clean & the atmosphere was very pleasant, calm and just sooo nice. So grateful for a good experience for a big family dinner.
